metadata.Title: CVE-2015-1290 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
The Google V8 engine, as used in Google Chrome before 44.0.2403.89 andQtWebEngineCore in Qt before 5.5.1, allows remote attackers to cause adenial of service (memory corruption) or execute arbitrary code via acrafted web site.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-1290` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 65.0.3325.181-0ubuntu1
chromium-browser-l10n - 65.0.3325.181-0ubuntu1
chromium-chromedriver - 65.0.3325.181-0ubuntu1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 65.0.3325.181-0ubuntu1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 65.0.3325.181-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '65.0.3325.181-0ubuntu1').
